description: Prospective teachers learn strategies to use when communicating with students who are experiencing personal difficulties. Communication with parents, family members and other professionals who have a vested interest in the student's well-being is emphasized. Professional liability is a major component of the course. The course uses role playing to help students develop communication expertise. Topics include confidentiality, professional liability and boundaries, crisis intervention, teen pregnancy, chemical use, abuse and neglect, suicide and depression and making referrals. Prerequisite: Education 290 or permission of instructor.

prerequisites: Prerequisite: Education 290 or permission of instructor.
